column4: taking apart the stage
column5: carrying out the chairs. Biden is still here at Pentagon

text: Biden hasn't left the Pentagon
column4: still here shaking hands with families in very hot sunshine.

text: 9/11 was my second day on the WH beat for the NYT. My first presidential trip was on 9/14 to Ground Zero
column4: with fighter jets escorting AF 1.

text: Obama expected at the Pentagon about 3 pm to lay a wreath and to speak to the families.
Everyone got their own wreath, everyone was personalized, says 9/11 widow Lisa Dolan about Pentagon service.
Pentaton 9/11 ceremony was "very intimate and very personal
column4:
says Lisa Dolan, widow of Capt. Robert Dolan, killed here a decado ago.
112907433629843460,Sun Sep 11 15:16:44 +0000 2011,Biden is still at the Pentagon talking to families of the victims. He's been here for close to 2 hours now.
112896863698567170,Sun Sep 11 14:34:44 +0000 2011,Taps have just been played at Pentagon, a passing plane has drowned out part of benediction.
112894053279993860,Sun Sep 11 14:23:34 +0000 2011,Soldiers, sailors, airmen and Marines in full military dress are now laying wreaths of white flowers on each of 184 benches at memorial.
112893079643619330,Sun Sep 11 14:19:42 +0000 2011,Biden: May God protect our troops."

text: Biden at Pentagon: Biden seems to be speaking off the cuff
column4: or is at least not looking much at the teleprompter. Very emotional.

text: Biden at Pentagon: "I know what it is like to receive that call out of the blue when the dearest thing in your life is gone."
Panetta: "More than 6
column4: 200 soldiers
column5: sailors
column6: airmen and Marines lost in the line of duty" since 9/11

text: Panetta: "We pledge to never forget the enemy that made this happen and why we fight them."
Panetta drowned out by passing plane from RR National Airport.
Panetta at Pentagon ceremony: "There are no words to ease the pain you still feel."
Members of armed services move to 9/11 Memorial to lay wreaths at each of 184 benches commemorating each victim who died here.
After Mullen's remarks Navy Sea Chanters Chorus begins "Battle Hymn of the Republic."
Mullen: 2 million have deployed to wars since 9/11
Mullen at Pentagon: "You
column4: the families
column5: have shown the rest of us the way..." Terrorists "could not bring down Americans."

text: Mullen at Pentagon 9/11 ceremony: "No music can assuage...lives ended in this place
column4: dreams were shattered."

text: Now the US Navy Sea Chanters Chorus is singing "Amazing Grace." Haunting on this morning.
We're observing a moment of silence at the Pentagon - 9:37 am
column4: the time American Airlines 77 crashed into the building's west side.

text: Biden has taken his place behind podium with Panetta and Mullen. Colors are being presented at Pentagon 911 ceremony.
It's eerie that commercial planes continue to take off from RR Natl Airport and continue to fly over Pentagon during 9/11 ceremony.
United States Army Band is playing "My Country 'Tis of Thee" in prelude concert. People are fanning themselves with programs in the heat.
Military aides are escorting families of survivors to their seats. An enormous American flag has been hung from the Pentagon's west side.
Families are arriving at the private Pentagon 9/11 Memorial service to start at 9:30 am. Security is tight
column4: warm sunshine
column5: solemn mood.

text: Panetta now heading to Teeterboro to try to take off in Osprey from there. Weather too bad in Manhattan. This is a long day trip.
Panetta says threat from Al Qaeda "remains real" after touring 9/11 Memorial in Lower Manhattan. Now waiting on his Osprey to fly him to DC
Panetta running late for visit to NYC 9/11 Memorial. Waiting for his Osprey to land at heliport.
